etymology.description: Pictogram: a mortar. See the original version of 舂, in which a pestle is visible on top.
etymology.interpretation: A direct drawing of a mortar, showing the bowl used for pounding. Connection to 舂 (to pound) is historical, where a pestle appears above. Similar shapes seen in 學、兒、䳔、鼠、叟 are coincidental and unrelated.

examples.chinese: 他用杵在臼里舂米(他用杵在臼裡舂米)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng chǔ zài jiù lǐ chōng mǐ.
examples.english: He uses a pestle to pound rice in the mortar.

examples.chinese: 这个石臼很重(這個石臼很重)。
examples.english: This stone mortar is very heavy.

examples.chinese: 实验室里常用研钵和研杵(實驗室裡常用研鉢和研杵)。
examples.pinyin: Shíyànshì lǐ cháng yòng yánbō hé yánchǔ.
examples.english: In laboratories, a mortar and pestle are commonly used.
